page.title: 13Shotwick Church.
page.content: St.Michael's Shotwick is a very old sandstone church,situated in a secluded and romantic setting.The church and the group of old houses forming the little village.On the very old wall around the church we can today see the linked chains that were used years ago to chain the boats to the church wall,but today the sea is some 3 to 4 kilometres away.As you enter the Norman doorway-built in the 15th century you can see groves worn in the stone in the porch made by 16th century archers sharpening their arrows.In the east window there is 14th century glass while the pulpit is 3 decked.In the windows of the chancel and chapel are the remains of the very highly coloured painted glass, originally representing figures and shrine work.In the North Aisle-East window we see Mary and Gabriel.
